channel.title: .net core on Piotr Wachulec
channel.description: Recent content in .net core on Piotr Wachulec

item.title: #30DEVSTORIES - my knowledge, thoughts and experience
item.description: Intro In the Polish IT Community, we had a great initiative on Instagram inspired by Guys from these two profiles: @kjendrzyca and @devenv.pl. Through 30 days we were sharing short Instagram stories related to our dev live - we shared our knowledge, our thoughts, and our experience. If you would like to check stories of other participants - here is a link: https://30devstories.crd.co/ or https://30devstories.pl/. In my Instagram stories, I shared much information related to C#/.

item.title: Feature toggles in .NET Core and Azure
item.description: Intro Feature toggles is an mechanism which allows you to control features and manage them within your application. For instance if you want to disable some functionality you can to that by changing some part of configuration without redeployment, rebuild etc. In this post I will show you how to configure it in a few easy steps in .NET Core web application and Azure. At the end you will find repository with example code which you can test it on your own.

item.title: Live Unit Testing with .NET and Visual Studio
item.description: A few days ago I was looking for something related to unit tests in the Microsoft documentation. I came to the tab titled ‘Live unit testing’ and I decided to check what is it. It is quite interesting, because why I have to click to run unit tests when I made small changes in code? We have the live reload functionality in frontend or some mobile technologies to see changes in the interface, so the developer don’t have manually click F5 to refresh the page.
